bug.author: jlewi
bug.summary: Profile controller uses cluster level roles
bug.description:
When I create a profile with the profile controller; it looks like the default edit account binds to a cluster level role named "edit." Should we be using a regular role so the bindings are namespace scoped? <denchmark-code>kubectl -n kubeflow-jlewi get rolebinding -o yaml default-editor apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1 kind: RoleBinding metadata: creationTimestamp: 2019-07-11T16:53:09Z name: default-editor namespace: kubeflow-jlewi ownerReferences: - apiVersion: kubeflow.org/v1alpha1 blockOwnerDeletion: true controller: true kind: Profile name: kubeflow-jlewi uid: 5cc0b4cd-a3fc-11e9-8c9b-42010af0003b resourceVersion: "73526" selfLink: /apis/rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1/namespaces/kubeflow-jlewi/rolebindings/default-editor uid: 5cc89148-a3fc-11e9-8c9b-42010af0003b roleRef: apiGroup: rbac.authorization.k8s.io kind: ClusterRole name: edit subjects: - kind: ServiceAccount name: default-editor namespace: kubeflow-jlewi </denchmark-code>
/cc <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kunmingg>@kunmingg</denchmark-link>

Looks like I'm mistaken. <denchmark-link:https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/access-authn-authz/rbac/>https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/access-authn-authz/rbac/</denchmark-link>
We can use a ClusterRole so that we only need a single role to be defined for all namespaces. Using a RoleBinding as opposed to ClusterRoleBinding can then scope it to a particular namespace.
